db:abstract.db:para: Applies random wave curves to particles.
This type was introduced in Qt 6.2.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This element applies random wave curves to particles. Curves can combine global values which are the same for all particles and unique values which differ randomly.

db:section.db:title: fadeInDuration : int
db:section.db:para: This property defines the duration in milliseconds for fading in the affector. After this duration, the wandering will be in full effect. Setting this can be useful to emit from a specific position or shape, otherwise wander will affect position also at the beginning.

db:section.db:title: fadeOutDuration : int
db:section.db:para: This property defines the duration in milliseconds for fading out the affector. Setting this can be useful to reduce the wander when the particle life time ends, for example when combined with Attractor3D so end positions will match the shape.

db:section.db:title: globalAmount : vector3d
db:section.db:para: This property defines how long distance each particle moves at the ends of curves. So if the value is for example (100, 10, 0), all particles wander between (100, 10, 0) and (-100, -10, 0).

db:section.db:title: globalPace : vector3d
db:section.db:para: This property defines the pace (frequency) each particle wanders in curves per second.

db:section.db:title: globalPaceStart : vector3d
db:section.db:para: This property defines the starting point for the pace (frequency). The meaningful range is between 0 .. 2 * PI. For example, to animate the x-coordinate of the pace start:

db:section.db:title: uniqueAmount : vector3d
db:section.db:para: This property defines how long distance each particle moves at the ends of curves at maximum.

db:section.db:title: uniqueAmountVariation : real
db:section.db:para: This property defines variation for uniqueAmount between 0.0 and 1.0. When the amount variation is 0.0, every particle reaches maximum amount. When it's 0.5, every particle reaches between 0.5 - 1.5 of the amount. For example if uniqueAmount is (100, 50, 20) and uniqueAmountVariation is 0.1, the particles maximum wave distances are something random between (110, 55, 22) and (90, 45, 18).

db:section.db:title: uniquePace : vector3d
db:section.db:para: This property defines the unique pace (frequency) each particle wanders in curves per second.

db:section.db:title: uniquePaceVariation : real
db:section.db:para: This property defines the unique pace (frequency) variation for each particle between 0.0 and 1.0. When the variation is 0.0, every particle wander at the same frequency. For example if uniquePace is (1.0, 2.0, 4.0) and uniquePaceVariation is 0.5, the particles wave paces are something random between (2.0, 4.0, 8.0) and (0.5, 1.0, 2.0).
